messages.message:
:cypress-spin:Cypress CI update: I added a tag `@non-blocking` to mark tests to be run in CI but test failures won't block merging (PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/61544)). This is useful for newly created Cypress testsâ€“we can test if all the env setup is correct and fix any flaky issues before turning it into merge blocking.
The `@skip-ci` tag is used to mark tests not to run in CI. This is useful for tests that cause concurrency issues. For example, the `drives.spec.ts` test will change the default drive which will break other Cypress tests.

I noticed that some Cypress run "non-blocking" groups will also run blocking tests. I'm not sure why this happens, but I solved this by rebasing master so that the frontend includes the linked PR.
Before: https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/13085/specs
After: https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/13087/specs
